newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK's Kwong Hing says to issue 45 mln shrs in IPO.
newsitem.headline: HK's Kwong Hing says to issue 45 mln shrs in IPO.

text.p: Hong Kong-based knitted fabrics maufacturer Kwong Hing International Holdings Ltd said it is offering 45 million new shares at HK$1.20 each in an initial public offering (IPO) of shares in Hong Kong.

The issue price represents a prospective price to earnings multiple of 5.59 times on a fully-diluted basis and 4.55 times on a weighted average basis for the year ending March 31, 1997, the company said.
The proforma dividend yield was 6.0 percent, it said.
Kwong Hing said the IPO will run from March 7 to 12 and dealing in its shares is expected to begin on March 19.
Standard Chartered Asia Ltd is the sponsor and manager of the issue.

The issue is expected to raise net proceeds of HK$33 million, of which HK$7.0 million will be used to buy knitting machinery, HK$6.0 million for the purchase of breaching, dyeing and setting machineries and HK$3.0 million will be used to construction factory premises in China.
Another HK$1.00 million is earmarked to upgrade the company's office information system and the remaining balance is used as working capital, Kwong Hing said.

The company forecasts a combined profit after taxation but before extraordinary items of not less than HK$42.3 million for the year ending March 31, 1997. This includes an exceptional gain of HK$11.3 million from the dispopal of properties.
The company recorded a profit of HK$26.05 million for the year ended March 31, 1996 and HK$17.65 million in fiscal 1995.
Kwong Hing provides fabric knitting dyeing and setting services and manufactures and sells knit fabrics.
